moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Nf6 4. Ng5 d5: Stienitz played this against Tchigorin in 1891 and lost, since then no one else tried it until this game.
moves.9... Bc5 10. O-O: Following Steinitz- Tchigorin , 1892, 6th game of their second match.  10 d3 is probably better
moves.10... O-O 11. d3 Bxh3: Bisguier takes up the challenge.  The Steinitz-Tchigorin game went 11...Nd5.
moves.12. gxh3 Qd7 13. Bf3 Qxh3: Material is now even.  Fischer believes his bishop pair gives him the advantage.
moves.14. Nd2 Rad8: if 14...e4? 15 Nxe4 Nxe4 16 Bxe4 Bd6 17 f4 (Fischer)
moves.15. Bg2: Forcing the queen off the h file.
moves.15... Qf5 16. Qe1 Rfe8 17. Ne4 Bb6 18. N: Better according to Fischer would be 19 ... g5 preventing the f4 break.
moves.20. Qc3: Supports f4 and stops ...g5.  Fischer remarks that the Black bishop is no more than a big pawn for the rest of the game.
moves.21. f4 Nd4 22. Qc4: Making way for c3 to drive the Black knight away.
A mistake.  Best was 26 ... Re8 threatening ...R8xe4 (Fischer)
